string.text: Who can receive extra recruitment slots from notables.
Prosperity increase for selling one prisoner.
Number of extra militia every day.
The multiplier to overall prosperity and hearth growth rate.
Modify food consumption and wages of garrison.
Multplier for garrison food consumption, and how many troops at garrison are lost because of food shortage.
Enable the new prosperity model. The new model gives settlements a natural new born growth rate and is affected by settlement capacity, trade, food storage and enemies around.
Natural growth capacity for village. 0 for unlimited.
Natural growth capacity for towns. Trade, buildings and other bonus can boost prosperity beyond natural capacity. 0 for unlimited.
Natural growth capacity for castles. Buildings and other bonus can boost prosperity beyond natural capacity. 0 for unlimited.
If prosperity is below this value, a town will stop generating new recruits.
The required prosperity for a town to generate more recruits.
Amount of prosperity past the threshold required for one extra recruitment slot.
The prosperity cost for one recuit.
If hearth is below this value, a village will stop generating new recruits.
The required hearth for a village to generate more recruits.
Amount of hearth past the threshold required for one extra recruitment slot.
The hearth cost for one recuit.
If prosperity is below this value, a castle will stop generating new noble recruits.
Controls the chance of castles getting noble recruits. If prosperity reaches the threshold, the castle is guaranteed to get one noble recruit every day.
Notable Power Threshold For Noble Recruit
Controls the chance of rural notables getting noble recruits. If power reaches the threshold, the notable is guaranteed to get notable recruits at every chance.
The power cost for one noble recuit.
